plants.name: Lilium bulbiferum
plants.description: A bright, vibrant lily native to Europe, producing striking orange flowers with dark spots. It often grows on meadows and rocky slopes.
plants.funFact: The Orange Lily is known for its bulbils that grow in the leaf axils, hence the name bulbiferum, meaning "bulb-bearing."

plants.funFact: It is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A daisy-like wildflower featuring bright yellow petals surrounding a dark brown center cone, commonly found in prairies and meadows.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies and are often used in wildflower gardens.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: A large aquatic plant producing large, fragrant pink or white flowers that rise above the water surface, revered in many Asian cultures.
plants.location: Asia (India, China, Japan), tropical and subtropical zones
plants.funFact: Sacred Lotus seeds can remain viable for over a thousand years and still germinate.
